alert.note: Alert for Brown (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 8:00PM CDT until April 04 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Brown County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 759 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles north of Forest City to Horton, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hiawatha, Horton, Everest, Robinson, Powhattan, Willis and Kickapoo Reservation. This warning replaces the previous warning set to expire at 800 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
